column1: decent pace first-up but sliding into the pads, Roy is off the mark with a nudge to leg
outside off, on the back foot, punched firmly to cover
on the toes, and that's sumptuous timing from Bairstow, clipped firmly in front of square. Everything he touches goes at the moment. (Even the balls to which he gets out...)
tapped to the leg side and through they jog
whipped to the leg side
pushed onto the back foot and tapped back down the pitch
pushed onto the back foot and there's a bit of a pop from a good length. Roy rides the bounce
left alone outside off stump
through to the keeper, and left alone once more
on the back foot again, a half-cock drive back to the bowler
slammed to the fence! You can't bowl there to any international batsman, or most club batsmen, to be fair. Short, wide, and in the slot for the cut
leaning onto the front foot, and pushed back down the pitch
another beautifully timed strike from Bairstow, utilising the width and extra pace, placing bat on ball, and easing it through backward point
fuller length, tighter line, drilled to cover
worked into the covers once more
attempted pull, sounded like a thin snick, but it was off the underside of the arm-pit as Roy was through his shot too soon
punched off the back foot, into the covers
good wheels to finish the over! A brisk bouncer, Roy contemplates a pull but the ball has soared past him
punched firmly into the covers but a good half-stop at point ... But Maxwell looks to have landed on his shoulder there... think he's okay
a flowing back-foot drive, straight to the fielder but good intent from Roy once more
full length, hint of outswing, tucked to short midwicket
attempted wallop across the line, no contact this time as the ball dies through to the keeper
full stride, down the pitch and defended to mid-off
another thump into the covers
worked to point
a hint of late nip back into the right hander, who can't time his drive, as it inside-edges into his thigh
that is butchered through the covers! Less movement this time, and Bairstow finds a full face, wonderful balance, on the front foot and whistling to the rope
a bottom-handed punch but straight to short cover this time
banged in short, but that's not too high for the umpire's liking. Well directed
a big swish across the line but that is through to the keeper
panned through the covers, oodles of bottom hand, lovely ball-striking
good sharp running, England looking lively
angling into the stumps, eased out to point off the front foot
nailed over long-off! That is formidable power, bottom hand coming through the line. It's a short boundary, but that would have cleared most!
flogged up and over extra cover this time! Not timed on this occasion, but Bairstow picks his spot well, finding space behind the inner ring. Expensive over...
another boundary, this time off the toes! Richardson over-compensates, slides into the pads, and is clipped imperiously in front of square
good areas to start, tweaking into the pads
pushed confidently into the covers, Bairstow's rapid running ensures an easy couple
thwacked with intent, up and overs the covers! One, two, three bounces and into the rope. Selective and dismissive
fuller face on a more probing length, pressed back down the pitch
squashed through point, and up comes England's fifty in dismissive fashion. Too much width and tonked to the rope!
pounded over the leg side! This is getting brutal already. The early arrival of spin has just clicked England into a higher gear. In the slot and duly slotted!
punched firmly, but back to the bowler
outside off, an offcutter, opens the face and glides down to third man
chopped to third man, a swishing back-cut
cut once more
another back-foot biff through backward point. This is naive cricket from Australia and England are utterly flying now
flogged off the front foot, tighter line this time, and cover intercepts
opens the face for a dab through third man

tighter line, Bairstow has a swish, and nicks through to the keeper! Bairstow was a victim of over-confidence there, looking to leather everything in his slot, but picking the wrong shot for that ball. The switch of ends works, and Australia have a toe-hold!
outside off, no stroke offered
through to the keeper, good tight line, slightly back of a length
fully forward and defended to the off side
onto the front foot once more
tucked off the pads, out to backward square leg
back of a length, firmly planted into the covers, and a slight misfield allows Hales to get off the mark
worked off the hip to square leg
pushed onto the back foot, defended back down the pitch
Hales is away, a trademark back-foot steer through point. Capitalising on too much width, and guiding it to the rope
banged in short, hauled into the leg side
tossed up, on the leg stump, pushed to mid-on
fully forward and tapped to the covers
full face and driven to the man at long-off
stretching forward, defended with respect back down the pitch
blocked into the covers
worked calmly into the gap at cover, a steadier second over for Agar
a bit of lift on a good length outside off, fenced to third man
cracked with an open face out into the covers
defended on the back foot, straight back down the pitch
back of a length, and that has lifted sharply through to the keeper! Threatening the splice as Hales keeps inside the line
flogged off the back foot, and Maxwell does well at point to cut off a certain four
whittled into the leg side, another single
striding onto the front foot, and pushed back past the bowler
blocked with a full face, through the gap at cover
glided off the back foot once more, dealing in singles for now just to keep things ticking over
looped up, met with a firm drive to long-off
too full, on the pads, tucked to midwicket for another single
another single into the covers
decent line and length outside off, and more extra pop from the medium-paced Stoinis. Defended
angled defence out to gully
defended off the back foot
hoisted with disdain out through deep midwicket
solid in defence once more
whipped off the toes, out through square leg
round the wicket, probing length, another pressed single to mid-off
back of a length, cracked hard to point
well bowled, good pace and flight, forcing Hales onto the back foot to defend
stout defence once more, good areas from Agar
chipped in the air, not timed well enough to reach the man at long-off
firmly forward to defend into the gap once more
thick outside edge They all count!
fuller and straighter, solid defence on the front foot
tucked to the leg side
banged in short, hoisted to the leg side
flipped off the toes, out to the leg side
over-pitched, and emphatically drilled along the ground and through the covers. A more convincing boundary to end the over, and bring up the hundred
big stride to defend
up on the toes, punched into the covers
opens the face and worked into the covers again
tighter line, worked to the leg side
cracked with intent along the ground, but gathered at long-off
on the back foot, poked back to the bowler
overpitched on the stumps and he launches a cross right over midwicket, skipping away to the rope for four
angled in, 78mph and worked for one
banged in short, Hales looks to pull but then changes his mind as the zips through above his shoulder
touch short, 83mph and tapped down
comes across to push a length ball into the off side
dug in again, 81mph on off stump, Hales latches on to a rasping pull shot and creams it in front of deep square leg, that's left the fielder with no chance
wanged down short, 88mph and too hot for Roy as he thinks better of hooking
rising off a length, dabbed down behind point and they scurry through as Maxwell fields to his left, whirls around and fires in a throw, misses the stumps
length, 85mph and defended into the covers

oh, ripped through 'im! Richardson spears Hales with the perfect line and length, through the gate to hit the top of middle! That's Kryptonite for Hales, seaming in and sending him back to the hutch for a middling score
Root lines this up in defence
short and at the body, 88mph but that's bread and butter on the hip, Root skims it fine and beats the man on the rope to get off the mark with a four
short, 78mph and whirled on the pull for four! Superbly placed in front of the man at fine leg this time
tapped down into a gap, that's fifty for Roy - taken just 52 balls, politely applauded around the ground
length on off, defended as he comes across
driven off the back foot, nicely timed but straight to mid-off, the ball skips up off the pitch and nearly causes Marsh a mischief
pitched up and dinked down the ground for a single
back of a length outside off, runs one more to third man
fullish and driven coming forwards, picks out extra cover
dabbed down, just a few yards into the off side, Roy looks to his partner and is called through for a comfortable one
pitched up and Root opens the face on a lovely square drive that again threads the gap for four
short of a length, 86mph and angling in, tucked to the leg side
better lines from Jhye R, 87mph and blocked on the front foot
full and driven coming forwards, comes off the toe of the bat back to the bowler
short ball, high and leg side - but not called wide
angled in and tucked off the hip
back of a length outside off, Root steers a single through point
fore! And that's six! Roy brings out his golf clubs and drives a long ball down the fairway towards the River Taff... watch out in the stands
full toss, 77mph on leg stump, flubbed along the ground to long-on
dug in short, Root swivels on a pull shot for one
shortish, 83mph outside off, Root drops deep and dabs a late cut behind point
full, 87mph outside off, Root punches to mid-off coming forwards
slightly short and wide and chopped away square with a horizontal bat

length, Roy gets low and pushes at the ball, slightly open face... and he gets a thick edge wide of the diving Paine for four! No slip in place now, think Richardson went wide and angled it in, drew the mistake but Roy gets away with it
banged in short, zipping through over the shoulder
pitched up, 90mph in the channel, dropped through cover point for a single
slower ball, down the leg side, flicked for one
oof, that's surprised Root, an effort ball that jumps and hits the glove/bat handle as Root fends in front of his chest
length, 84mph, Root comes across and steers through point
hits a good length on off stump, defended with a straight bat and a big stride
slightly too full in the channel, 80mph and a scrambled seam, Roy is immediately back on the offensive, drilling four through extra cover
short, width for the batsman, slapped off the back foot through point
shortish outside off and tapped down into the covers
back of a length, 81mph and sliding down the leg side for a wide
tight lines, coming back in at Roy, who can only deflect it towards backward point
this is prodded down in front of Maxwell, who hares up and has a shy at the non-striker's end, Roy judged it well
fullish and punched back past the bowler
dug in, 78mph and Roy brings out the forehand smash to get this in front of deep square leg for a couple
dropped into the covers and they scamper through, a direct hit would have been close with Root running his bat in at the striker's end
Roy comes across and defends a length ball
short, taking the pace off, 70mph outside off and Roy mistimes a cross-batted whack
dug in, Roy is on it in a flash, pounding a brutal blow into the crowd at deep midwicket! That's the longer part of the ground to hit to, but it soared off the middle for six!
fullish and dinked into the on side for one
pitched up, 78mph on middle and leg, Root works it wide of mid-on
too straight again and this is wristily chaperoned in front of deep midwicket for a couple
outside off and steered down to third man
touch short, 78mph and Roy mistimes into the off side
back of a length and this is helped away through midwicket with a roll of the wrists
not a bad ball from Kane-R, 84mph and on a length in the channel, but Root places it superbly on the drive past extra cover and in front of the sweeper for three
short ball, swatted away on the pull in front of deep midwicket
thuds into the pads, taking the pace off, Richardson asks the question... but that was heading down
full, dipping on the stumps and flicked to midwicket on the bounce
this jump at Root again, 78mph and rising up to hit the splice as he fends it away
angled in with the arm and worked through the leg side
pitched up, Roy hammers a drive at extra cover and Agar can't collect it first time, the ball bobbling away and they take one

pulled flat hard into the deep - but D'Arcy Short dives forward to hold a blinder! Stoinis celebrates, but credit to the catcher, a fine bit of work on his debut! Root had skipped down as the ball was banged in short, he tried to get on top of an aggressive panhandle through midwicket and looked like he might get away with it... only for Short to come up standing tall, scooping the ball up inches from the turf and then holding tight as he slid forwards
fullish length, 82mph and clipped uppishly towards mid-on
turned into the leg side
slower delivery, Roy nudges it away
hard length, 82mph rising outside off, steered towards backward point
taking the pace off again, 65mph and Roy is through a forcing shot early, spooned into a gap at cover for one to the sweeper
stays back and works a single through the leg side
fuller, 85mph outside off, tip and run wide of mid-off and they make it through comfortably
length ball around off stump, jabbed into the covers
slightly short, 77mph and he shows it a straight bat on off stump
angled in a little straighter and Roy punches one down the ground
banged in back of a length, stops in the pitch slightly and Buttler take a blow on his hip pulling across the line
length ball in the channel, dabbed behind square
short and pulled away through square leg for one... and the rain is tipping down again now
lobs up a full toss from over the wicket, Buttler twocks it down the ground for one
nicely flighted, bit of spin back into Roy as he presses forward, hit on the knee roll
tossed up on leg stump, Roy gets low and swats a sweep to fine leg
now Buttler shuffles across and paddles the ball away, gets it fine and they come back for two
lobbed up and tucked square, into a gap again and there's another brace for Buttler, showing placement instead of power here
now comes the hurt, floated up wide of off stump and Buttler drills four through the covers to cap a good over for England, back in their groove already
good length, 80mph on off stump and Roy defends watchfully back to the bowler
short ball, into his arc and Roy slugs it up and away over mid-on for four
full on the stumps, punched back past the bowler, mid-off comes across
back of a length on off stump, not a bad delivery but Buttler forces it in front off deep cover off the back foot for a couple
dug in, 78mph, Buttler rides the bounce and dabs to short third man
short again, this time Buttler plays a controlled pull in front of deep midwicket for a couple
round the wicket, tossed up on off and poked into a gap
flighted, Buttler gets on to the front foot and drives wide of long-off, just one
angled in and punched through mid-off, Roy moves on to 99
on the stumps and tapped to midwicket
quicker delivery, stabbed through the covers for a single to the sweeper

floated up outide off, Roy steps across and steers the ball square, calls for two and celebrates his fifth ODI hundred after getting back comfortably... A fine innings from Roy, ending a run of middling scores
Buttler prods at the ball, gets a thin, low edge through to the keeper on the bounce
short and pulled, wide of the man at fine leg for a couple
fullish, 82mph and pushed down the ground to long-on
full toss outside off, just a single via a bottom-handed slap through the covers
pitched up and driven square for a couple more
slower ball, Buttler is on to the front foot and lofts it over extra cover, smoothly done and it bounces away to the rope
tossed up into the toes, clipped square
pressed forward on the front foot, a slight inside-edge into the crease
reverse-swept, and impeccably so! Fizzes away through backward point. Hard to defend that one
stabbing forward, deflected to backward square and that's a good decisive call from Buttler
on the back foot, tapped to cover
deflected down through third man
over-pitched outside off, and that is lambasted back past the bowler!
tucked to the leg side, as Roy picks the slower ball
pushed down the leg side and that's a nasty bounce into Tim Paine's face! The ball just kicked off the turf as he stooped to gather, and he had no place to go.
back of a length, slower ball, slapped behind point and good running too
a flamboyant drive through the covers! Flogged on the up, pierces the field. All of these breaks are doing nothing to disrupt Roy's momentum

that, on the other hand, will do very nicely! A cross-seamer from Tye, zipping into the right-hander, catching the toe of the bat as it does so, and what a take from Paine! Changing direction to fling himself down the leg-side, and grabbing in one hand. Quite the recovery from his blow in the face just now!
beats the edge, another knuckleball, and Paine wears this one on the chest as it zips through on the second bounce. Awkward times behind the stumps
pushed straight back to the bowler
solidly into line
drawn forward to defend
hitting inside-out, to deep point
outside off, cut firmly to backward point
another cut, zipped through a bit flatter, and gathered at backward point
paddle-sweep from Billings, a bit of a top-edge, but he's off the strike safely enough
poked into the covers, finding the gap once more
good delivery, a full-length outswinger, and pushed back to the bowler
leg-sided, dipping into the batsman's pads as he sweeps fine. Good sliding stop from Jichardson
up on the toes, punched to cover
stretching forward in defence, and gathered with a scramble by Maxwell
round the wicket, cramped for room on the pads
a bit more width as Buttler stays leg-sided and clobbers a drive into the covers
fully forward, head over the ball, and defended
dipping late, blocked to cover for another single
back of a length and quicker through the air, bounces sharply as Billings pokes off the back foot
inside-edged defence to the man on the 45. Good control from Australia for the moment
back of a length, tweaking into the right hander, can't get the angle into a back-foot push
swept, but misses everything
another attempted sweep, on a leg-stump line, an under-edge from Billings. He gets the single, but isn't looking settled yet
tucked fine, off the pads, doesn't have the pace to reach the rope as backward square gallops round to gather
beaten outside off, another grope at nothing
a roundhouse hoick to the leg side. Excellent work from the leggie
crashed through the covers! That is sweet timing, the sweeper didn't have far to go, but there was no intercepting that!
ramped for six! The reinjection of pace has reinjected Buttler's innings!
exhibition stuff from Buttler! Walking across his stumps, using the pace on the full length, and leaning it into the fine leg sightscreen!
back of a length, a murderous cut shot ... gathered by the sweeper but not before Buttler has brought up his fifty with a sudden burst of energy!
slower ball, on the legs, clipped fine
forward and drilled into the covers
misses out on a sweep
good diving stop on the cover boundary
swept to fine leg
another exocet of a cover drive! He is utterly nailing those at the moment, in all formats
back of a length, pushed to mid-on
notches up the single to long on
back of a length, walloped through backward square. He's in the mood now!
fuller length, met under the eyeline, and crunched up to mid-off
swinging down the leg side, another extra to the cause
solidly drilled down to long-off
pushed out to the off side, another fifty stand
inside-edge onto the stumps! The slower ball does for Billings ... he never got going really, failed to pick the variation and shivered his own timbers
short and slapped in front of square! Moeen is not going to hang around, and he's got licence to wallop today! This could be fun ...
attempted wipe through the leg side, but that one is through him too quickly
down the leg side, but Buttler is walking across the stumps and can't make contact
a flat-batted mow, straight down the ground and into the non-striker's stumps
slower ball, Buttler uses the lack of pace to glide one down to third man
back of a length, tapped into the covers
a swish across the line, can't make contact. A lull in England's tempo in that over
worked off the pads to the leg side
outside off, carved out to deep cover
an edged drive, down to third man
slower ball, very full length, clipped urgently out to midwicket
back of a length from round the wicket, crashed back past the bowler to bring up the 300
good length for the nipbacker, Buttler drives with a high elbow but can't get the stroke away
swung out to the deep, and picks out the man at square leg! The short ball did for him at The Oval, it's the full one this time, Moeen comes and goes without much impact
slow bouncer, outside off, and chopped to point
slower ball, on the pads, worked to the leg side
fizzes through an attempted pull, half an appeal ... but nothing much doing there
short again, pulled ... and just drops short of backward square! He didn't over-commit to the catch, perhaps fearing he'd give away four ...
banged in short, down the leg side
slower ball, down to 65mph, and Willey can't get it away
on the back foot, tucked back down the pitch
outside off, fenced down into the crease and gathered behind the stumps
very full, attempted wipe down the ground but can't really connect
wider line outside off, and chopped to cover
wide full-toss, carved down to third man. A good gather on the boundary's edge by Marsh. Willey is a bit miffed that that wasn't a no-ball
drilled to cover
banged in short, through to the keeper
a swish into the leg side, but can't connect properly. They settle for the scampered single
cracked hard into the leg side, taking on the short ball, and not quite timing it. Lands safe in no-man's land
attempted ramp, Richardson adapts his line, so Buttler jabs the toe of his bat at the ball to pick off the single to third man. Impressive ninja skills for the single
attempted swish from a full length, can't connect once more. Australia are brawling well at the death
slower ball, short of a length, into the body, deflects to leg
slower ball, top-edged over the keeper
that's in Willey's slot! A bit of a half-tracker outside off, and panned back whence it came, through long off
short, swished, top-edged, more runs!
wide of off stump, a stand-and-deliver wipe from Willey, but can't connect
banged in short again, and Richardson does brilliantly to hurtle out to point in his followthrough to complete the caught and bowled! England's flaccid finale continues
... but it's Buttler who plunks this one! Clean through midwicket as Richardson bangs it in short.
sharp bouncer ... good thinking, but it's too short as Plunkett tries to wipe one off his eyebrows
slashed off the full length, down to third man. Buttler back on strike ...
short and slapped to mid-on, a bit scuffed, but they take the single
whoops, a mistimed wipe to the leg side, a non-existent single, but Plunkett figures it's better to get Buttler back on strike. He's not even in the frame as the bails are whipped off. Fair play!
short, slapped down the ground, back they come for two. This innings may appear to have petered out ... but it is still their highest ODI total against Australia!
finds the gap, off the toe of the bat, chasing the wide ball, but picks out the long boundary for one more boundary!
bouncer, banged in short, banged out through the leg side! Buttler finds the final flourish to set Australia an imposing total target of 343!
shortish and sliding leg side, Head tickles it off his hip and that'll be four from the first ball
that's a beauty to follow up, swinging away late as Head closes the face and is beaten
length, 82mph in the channel, lets this one shape away and through to the keeper
angled in straighter, Head works the ball to mid-on
fired in full, looking for swing but it drifts on to the pads and Head skelps it past short fine leg and away for four more
back of a length, 77mph and chopped into the ground as he hops across
sprints in like a javelin thrower and spears this down the leg side to start with
touch short and nudged off the hip, Hales runs across at square leg... and then slips over, allowing them to come back for a second
back of a length, 86mph around off stump and pushed gently into the covers
banged in, 89mph and targeting the ribs, Short tucks it away to fine leg for a single
angled across the bows, good pace and carry and Head lets this one go
bumper, 89mph and Head plays this beautifully, flicking up his hands at the last minute to send the ball sailing into the sight screen over the keeper's end

thuds into the pads, England go up for lbw... Alex Wharf shakes his head, but Buttler goes to the DRS, they think that's a good shout against Head. However, Hawk-Eye quickly demonstrates the ball pitched outside leg stump, so England lose their review and Head keeps his wicket
length outside off, teasing the batsman, Short leaves
touch short, 83mph and sliding in to deflect off the thigh pad, runs away square and they steal a leg bye
length ball on off, Head pushes it back to the bowler
good lines from Willey, 84mph on fourth stump and Head strokes it to mid-off
finds a testing area again, this nibbles away a fraction off the pitch, into the gloves as Head fiddles outside off
gets a little straighter, 82mph and it's calmly tucked through square to the man outside the ring for one
short and wide and crunched through point, poor ball and he belts the cover off it

flicked into the leg side, uppish but dying in front of midwicket... where Hales scoops up a brilliant one-handed catch! That is a superb effort, throwing himself forward and low to his right! They are going to check with the TV umpire, but the soft signal is out. Yep, Dharmasena is happy, England have the breakthrough. Wood has lopped off Australia's Head!
stays round the wicket, pitched up at 89mph, defended coming across
angling in with the arm, blocked on off stump
back of a length, 86mph and whirring in, turned towards short midwicket
comes across on off stump, opens the face and runs a single behind point
tight stuff from Willey, Marsh shows it a straight bat on off stump
comes across and taps watchfully away
just a touch too full this time and Marsh plays this nicely, eased through the covers for three
in the channel, this doesn't really swing and Short has a flat-footed yahoo, plays all around it
length on the stumps, Short chops it back down the track
touch wider, 82mph and steered towards point
fired in straight, Wood goes down in his follow through but is able to pick up the ball as it is rolled gently back towards him by Marsh
short, swung away down the leg side, off the bottom edge and fine leg cleans up
back of a length, 85mph around fourth stump, Head defends
good length, 88mph and it clips the inside edge as Short presses forward
angled in and worked back towards mid-on
dug in short and flicked off the body, couple through backward square leg

dropped! This one doesn't stick, despite a fabulous effort from Bairstow... Marsh struck it firmly off his pads, it flew to short midwicket but went just as quickly to ground. Barely any time to react
bit of width and Marsh times the ears off this, absolutely pinged through backward point
fired in, 83mph and worked off the pads
pitched up, 85mph and driven, Willey gets a hand on it in his follow through and it dribbles to mid-off
dug in short, 84mph and Short mistimes a pull, it loops wide of short fine leg as Rashid gives chase
pitched up and leathered on the drive, Root flings himself at extra cover and gets a hand on it
back of a length, 85mph and tucked to the leg side
fullish, stroked into the covers
Wood fires this down the leg side
better length, worked off the pads to midwicket
short ball, Marsh pulls but it comes off the glove and bobbles to the right of the keeper
in the channel, hits the pitch hard and Marsh fails to connect
dug in, 85mph, Marsh latches on to the pull and slots it away through backward square leg for four
short of a length, tucked off the legs and fielded by Rashid running up from short fine
good length, 81mph on off stump, defended towards point
touch wide, 83mph on a length and Marsh is able to reach out and open the face for a couple to the left of third man
fuller, gets him driving, sends it along the ground to point
touch short and leg side, 80mph, deflected off the inside edge for one
slower ball, Short gets forward and checks it towards mid-off, they scuttle through for the single
fired into the pitch cross seam, short and leg side and Short gets it away past the man on the ring for his first boundary - that brings the Australia 50 up
back of a length and angled across, chopped towards point
drifts on to the pads again, Short only needs to tickle this away to fine leg for four more
still leg side, 82mph and flicked away in front of short fine leg, just a single
gets this on a better line, outside off stump to the left-hander, pushed into the covers
back of a length and worked off the hips again, wide of short fine leg and deep square ends up coming around to cut it off
round the wicket, pushed through and chopped into the covers, where a misfield gives them one
flighted, Short pushes a little tentatively and pops the ball short of Roy in the covers
tossed up outside off, punched through cover point
looped up and tapped back to the bowler
pushed through on off stump, Marsh punches into the covers
length ball, straightening on off stump, Short jabs it down in front of slip
length outside off, 83mph and Marsh pushes it back past the bowler, mid-off comes across
skiddy, on a length and hitting the pads, Plunkett goes up for lbw... Wharf again shakes his head. Pitched outside leg, possibly inside edge, as well
too straight, he's flicked fine once again, Wood does terrifically down on the rope, however, to prevent four
round the wicket now, flicked through backward square leg
angled in with the arm and Marsh defends to the on side
touch short, 83mph and tapped down to leg
pushed through, gripping a touch as Short goes back and mistimes a cut
comes across and pushes one into the covers
dropped! Taken on the full and flicked to midwicket, where the substitute Tom Curran is fielding, hits the fingertips and goes down
Marsh steps out and pushes a single down the ground
flat on the stumps and worked away into the leg side
floated up on off, Marsh cushions the ball wide of extra cover and they scurry through
floated up from round the wicket, turned through the leg side
round arm, drifting in on to off stump, Marsh digs it out
floated up full, driven to long-on for a single
flatter outside off and Marsh dinks one into a gap in front of point
tossed up and flipped back down the track to the bowler
slung down on middle and off, Short can only tap it away
pushed through and Marsh drills it down the ground, Bairstow has to run across from long-off... but he dives across to prevent four
pushed through and steered into the off side for one
tossed up, punched to extra cover
floated up slower and stroked to extra cover again

bit of turn, Short plays back, edged and snapped up at slip! Moeen strikes again, he's enjoying bowling to Australia... Short hadn't looked particularly adept, he had his struggles in the IPL, of course, and now he's heading back for 21 off 33 on ODI debut
over the wicket, floated up full and he gets down low to paddle one around the corner
stays round the wicket to the right-hander, lobbed up and tucked off the pads
drifting in a touch with the arm, Marsh punches a drive past extra cover
flighted, nice and slow and pitching on middle stump, Stoinis defends
pushed through quicker, goes back and nurdles one in front of square on the leg side
tossed up on off, tapped into the covers
tight lines, gripping a smidgen and Marsh defends
flat, spinning in a touch, Stoinis defends
flighted, comes on to the front foot and blocks towards extra cover
floated up, Stoinis works it back past the bowler
chipped back down the ground, shouts of 'catch!' but it was wide of the bowler
on the stumps, Stoinis shows it a straight bat
touch short and turning down the leg side, jabbed away to deep backward square but there's only a single there
slung down from round the wicket, tucked back to the bowler
angled across and patted to extra cover
darted on middle and leg, clipped through square

humpty, at last! Marsh dances down and slots a sweet lofted drive over long-on for six! First one of the innings - first boundary in eight overs, in fact. And it has damaged the ball, so there is going to be a delay
tucked to the leg side
played right under the eyeline, clipped to the leg side
on the back foot, pushed on the up to the leg side
solid defence on the back foot
punched in the air, playing with the spin, a checked drive over cover
googly, but sliding past the pads
blocked with a straight bat, an inside-edge deflects past square leg
outside off, and cut hard through deep point
stretching forward to defend into the leg side
tucked to short midwicket
through to the keeper, on a full length with nice shape off the seam

bosh! Back of a length, skids through Stoinis's defences, and into the stumps via an inside edge! Plunkett rewarded for hitting the length and extracting natural variation. Definitely kept low but it was a cross-seamer which exacerbated the lack of bounce
too straight, flicked fine, off the pad but that'll do nicely for Australia
good length, attacking the stumps from back of a length, hurried defence on the back foot
this one bursts past the edge! Lovely follow-up, similar length, but really climbs off the deck. The cross-seamer paying dividends for Plunkett
thrashed on the up, out through backward point
big stride forward to defend
crashed on the up through the leg side. Top strike
tucked out to midwicket

pinned on the shin and up goes the finger! Finch thinks about reviewing but thinks better of it. He was down on the sweep, plumb in front, and after a brief consultation he turns and walks. Huge wicket!
tossed up, dipping into Maxwell's drive, pushed to cover
solid block back down the pitch
worked back to the bowler on the front foot
pushed with hard hands and this one zips off the seam and nearly takes Buttler off his feet as he gathers! Sharp bowling!
nipping back into the right hander from just back of a length
thuds the pad, sliding down the leg side
on the legs, clipped firmly out to deep midwicket
flogged hard through the covers, that's a confident strike, dancing down to meet the pitch on a wide line, and cracking it hard along the ground
back of a length, punched in a similar direction off the back foot this time
firmly driven, along the ground to cover
tossed up, a googly on a leg-stump line to the left-hander, and blocked
another wrong'un, pushed to cover and they run a cheeky two as Curran the sub fumbles in the deep
flipped to leg, another googly
full length and pushed back to the bowler
on the back foot, tucked to the leg side
driven with an open face, out to point
short and flogged hard through square leg, that's good intent. Picking the length early and hauling it round the corner
tapped firmly down the ground, a sharp single
short, wide, and slapped hard through the covers! That sat up and begged, and it completes a decent over for Australia
in the slot, and tonked mightily out to the longest part of the ground, at wide long-on... a couple of bounces and another boundary
on the legs, nudged out to deep square leg
looped into the toes, Maxwell gives himself room to stay leg-side and drive into the covers
met on the full, on the front foot, another urgent bit of running as Rashid chases out to midwicket
poked in the air out to short cover
tremendous batting! A feint to leg, then a booming lofted drive, high over the covers. Maxwell isn't giving this one up
round the wicket, a speared-in yorker, cracks Marsh on the toe but that's heading down leg. Lovely length though
angled in from round the wicket once more, and fenced down to third man
slashed, edged, four! That's a surefire way to reduce the requirement! No defending against that stroke
pushed uppishly, back past the bowler
angled in, worked to leg
fenced down to third man
glided out to deep cover
on the back foot, cracked into the covers
down the pitch, pushed to the off side, they scamper through
blocked on the front foot
clipped out to square leg
straightens on a leg-stump line and flicked fine
back of a length, punched into the covers
on the pads, tucked out to the leg side
pace! Maxwell shapes for the drive, then reflexively flings his neck backwards as the ball bursts off the seam and past the edge!
pushed firmly to mid-off and they rush through
opens the face on a slower delivery, and glides the single to third man
back of a length, fenced down to third man. A decent over, nothing loose, but Australia press on
pushed with a full face down to long-on
well bowled Moeen! Just back of a length, tweaking past the edge, and Buttler whips off the bails. No-one seems too excited, but the umpire is taking a look. On we go
on the pads, tapped to the leg side
forward and blocked to cover
forward and defended to the off side
down on the sweep as Marsh is rapped on the pad but that's heading down leg. No matter, it's a fine over, just the single from it
back of a length, skidding into a solid block
on the pads, worked to the leg side
on the hip, and flinched to the leg side
very full, attacking the stumps with skiddy pace, and driven hard to mid-on
sliding into the pads on a full length, no room to free the arms
round the wicket, back of a length, pulled hard but just short of Root at short midwicket! He did brilliantly to gather cleanly, that was travelling
blocked to leg
hoisted down the ground as Maxwell tries to stay leg-sided, but Moeen does him in the flight, cramps him for room, and Willey at mid-on takes the critical catch!
round the wicket and that is a tremendous strike! Just back of a length with too much width, and out comes a flowing back-foot punch through the covers
forward and blocked into the off side
tossed up once more, on a fuller length to the new batsman, who defends to mid-off to get off the mark
good delivery, pops and straightens on a good length, and an involuntary jab through third man rolls all the way to the rope
full and outside off, a loose drive flashes at nothing and Buttler gathers
banged in short, Agar's feet go nowhere as he defends down into the crease
fizzed through to the keeper, back of a length, but well enough directed to avoid being called wide
driven with an open face out to cover
short, and through to the keeper again. Wood's got his length spot on for the bouncer
pushed to cover, an automatic run, but Bairstow gathers cleanly and a direct hit would have been very tight!
round the wicket, outside off, cracked into the covers on the front foot
pushed into the off side once more
tip and run, out to point once more
forward and drilled out to cover
angled into the off side again, more good fielding but sharp running
tossed up, compactly driven to mid-off
short, and flashed in the air down to third man, a lot of runs coming on the off side at present, testament to England's good llines
cracked hard to deep cover, gathered by Billings as they jog another single
flipped through the leg side, on the pads for a change, and it's a long chase to pick that up behind square
jagging into the left-hander, worked off the hip
down the leg side, we'll have that one again
blocked to cover, solid off-stump line
on the back foot, squeezed out to backward point and a direct hit would have been close! But Roy's shy goes wide
tossed up straight, Marsh leans out and defends on middle and leg
comes forward and stokes one through cover
pushed through and tapped back
tasty from Agar, gets his first boundary with a languid slap over extra cover, beats the boundary rider
shows intent again, gets forward and punches back down the track
touch short, Agar swats one past the bowler to keep the strike
that's another sweet strike, just a fraction short and wide from Willey and Agar slashes it wide of third man for four more
back of a length, frees the arms again, bit top-edgey but it bounces safely down to third man
straighter line from the left-armer, worked to the leg side
rising from just back of a length, Agar drops into the crease but chops to backward point
on the stumps, punched in front of mid-on
short of a length and swiped down the ground off the back foot
pushed through on the stumps, pulled into the leg side for one
that's a lovely bit of batting, footwork and timing as he comes down and whips a full delivery in front of deep midwicket for four
worked into a gap for one
plays with a straight bat back down the track
pushed through, Agar swats at the ball and gets an inside edge
makes a bit of room to carve the single
round the wicket, worked away off the pads
super stuff from Marsh again, just a back-foot punch but he sends it racing fine of mid-on and away... just a shot from his hundred, now
length ball, defended into the off side
there it is, a firm clip off the pads and Marsh has his hundred - fourth overall and first since 2013. Can he go on to see this chase home?
keeps ticking over, nudging another single
banged in short and Agar ducks underneath
round the wicket and pushed through, sliced off the back foot
tossed up and driven square coming across
flat on the stumps, tapped back to the bowler
lobbed up full and drifting leg side, Marsh sweeps and gets it away off the pads
bit of width, Agar uses his long levers to slap the ball up and over extra cover, it beats the sweeper on the off side
and another, this time rocking back to crunch a pull square! Again he connects powerfully and gets it past the boundary rider
short and at the ribs, Marsh rides it and tucks the single
good pace, scrambled seam and the ball climbs past the top edge as Agar tries to cut on off stump
fired down the leg side, Buttler appeals but he wasn't close to hitting that
short outside off, Agar cuts into the ground towards backward point
low bounce, scooting through in the channel as Agar swings and misses
gets the boundary Australia need, short and leg side and Agar swats it away to fine leg, grins at the bowler
on the stumps, pushed back down the track
tossed up and worked down the ground for one
over the wicket, flighted on the stumps, Agar plays with the turn as Rashid gives chase
tossed up full outside off, Marsh prods through the covers
gives it some air, slugged down the ground to long-off on the bounce
drops back and whips the ball with the turn through the leg side

flat, wide of the stumps and Agar slaps a cut, straight to backward point... but Plunkett lets it through him to give up four! Australia clinging to the coat tails of this chase, but they're still alive!
short ball, Marsh seizes on it, hammers a pull into the stands a deep midwicket! That was absolutely smoked
pitched up a bit more and worked off the legs
goes over the wicket to Agar, who sits back and chops the ball toward backward point
dug in short and Agar pulls in the air, bounces towards deep square leg
round the wicket, fired down the leg side
takes the pace off, short and rising up to hit Marsh on the body as he swings and misses
half-tracker outside off from Wood and Agar flat-bats it down the ground through mid-off for four more!
tossed up and worked into the leg side
does him with the googly, Agar stumped well out of his ground! Lovely bit bowling, lured him down and then spun it away as Agar swung down the ground, Buttler finished the job
lobs up a legbreak from over the wicket, spinning away and chopped through the covers for one to get off the mark first ball
pushed through, Marsh swipes down the ground and they get a second on the misfield
floated up and worked down the ground to long-on
flat on the stumps, Paine clips a single off his hip
length, sliding down the leg side, Buttler appeals for the catch... bit of kidology, as there was not bat involved
short and on the hips, deflected wide of the keeper
full on the stumps, whipped into a gap at midwicket for a couple
short ball, Marsh presses out and smashes a pull, straight to deep midwicket
dug in, Paine takes on the pull and swings it away into the gap between deep square and fine leg for four
back of a length outside off, stabbed through the covers for one
full, misses the yorker and it's in the slot, Marsh slams it over wide long-off for six! The extra ball goes all the way, Wood taking some tap at the death!
flighted, worked into the leg side and they want two, Willey's throw is poor to the non-striker's end and Marsh dives in!
tossed up, Paine lofts a drive over the ring, wide of long-off and they run hard again
pushed through on the stumps, tapped down the ground
dragged down a touch, Marsh swats a pull for one into the deep
gets it very full, flat enough that Paine can't get under it as he sits on the back foot and swings
pushes through the googly, slapped past extra cover but Willey does well in the deep to prevent four
dropped! Full outside off, Paine slices it high over point... and Moeen can't grasp it on the run! He actually seemed to overrun it, got under the ball but saw it slip through his hands

short ball, into the body and Paine flips it straight to fine leg! This time the catch is held, a short-lived cameo from Paine but while Marsh is still at the other end Australia can dream. Think that was a cutter from Plunkett, no pace for Paine to work with
on the stumps, clipped down the ground for one

oh, GONE - bowled 'im! Plunkett hits the woodwork and Australia's best hope of winning walks off after a magnificent century. The crowd rises to applaud him up the steps, probably realising that wicket might have clinched the game... Slower ball from Plunkett, the cutter gripped and hit leg stump as Marsh swung across the line
on the stumps and worked for one
pitched up, drilled to mid-off and Root has a chance to throw down the stumps as Tye goes for the single... would have been gone all day but he misses!
floated up full, Tye heaves to leg, sends a spiralling top edge up towards midwicket... but it lands safely!
gets this one away, slog-swept behind square and Wood seemingly didn't pick it up! That'll be four, bouncing away over the rope, Rashid left chuntering about the fielding
pushed through and chopped for two more off the back foot
slider, Tye carts towards cow - picks out the man! Rashid is happy again, safely taken running across by one of England's best fielders, Tye unable to get the power and elevation he needed
pushed through and prodded into the off side
flighted, defended on off stump
slower delivery, clubbed towards wide long-on... and Roy tumbles to take an excellent diving catch! Plunkett has four and England have wrapped up victory by 38 runs in Cardiff!
